Abiatkar the hiyk priest] It is well enough known what is here said in defence of the purity of the text; namely, that Ahimelech the father was called Abiathar, and Abiathar the son was called also Ahimelech. But I suppose that some- thing more was propounded by our Saviour in these words. For it wase common to the Jews under ΑόἱατῘιαν to under- stand the Urim and Thummim. Nor without good reason, when it appears, that under the father and the son, both of that name, the mention of inquiring by Urim and Thummim is more frequent than it is ever anywhere else3 and, after Abiatkar the son, there is scarcely mention of it at all.
